law.catch_line: There is a Neighborhood Business Development Fund....

text.section: There is a Neighborhood Business Development Fund.

The Department shall use the Fund to:
operate and pay expenses of the Program; and
provide financial assistance to small businesses, nonprofit organizations, and microenterprises.

section.section: The Department shall administer the Fund.
The State Treasurer shall hold and the Comptroller shall account for the Fund.

text.section: The Fund is a continuing, nonlapsing special fund that is not subject to § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
The Fund shall be invested in the same way as other State money.

With the approval of the Legislative Policy Committee and, subject to § 7-209 of the State Finance and Procurement Article, after the first 8 months of a fiscal year, the Department may transfer unencumbered money in the Fund to any other fund established under this title.
